text: Hi, I have a multilingual dynamic webpage. I use the same hubdb tale for all language variations of the webpages. The link rel=alternate hreflang=“xx” is now completely wrong. I want to either remove it completely or manage it by myself in the template header. Is there a way to prevent HubSpot from automatically adding the alternate hreflang tag?
:wave: Hi Thorsten! There’s not a way to remove this as far as I’m aware, though I can look into it to be sure.

In any case, I’d like to know more about your use case - usually, people set up a different HubDB table for each language. I think we’ll get to a better setup in the future, but for now that’s usuallyt he best approach.
Can you share an example with me? You can DM me or email me at <mailto:svalsdottir@HubSpot.com|svalsdottir@HubSpot.com> if you’d rather not share here.
